Articles.Content:
According to both http://www.kerbalmaps.com/ and SCANsat there should be an anomaly in the Midland Crater at -9.8314 , 25.9177. I am currently landed in that very same crater, almost exactly at those same coordinates. There is no anomaly, neither above ground nor below. No arch, no Munolith, no monument. Nothing but regular ground scatter.

Am I missing something or are both kerbalmaps.com and SCANsat wrong?
There should be an arch there, I think.
After the last couple of updates several Easter eggs got put under the terrain.

Oh that one, highlight this comment for the spoiler.

.......................................................................

It's a monolith on the little hill in the middle of the crater, somewhat difficult to find because it's small.
I've already looked under the terrain. And as I stated in my original post: nothing there.
Yea, it may be slightly underground depending on your terrain settings (NOTE: the highest setting is not always the best).

Yea, it may be slightly underground depending on your terrain settings (NOTE: the highest setting is not always the best).

Which word in 'NOTHING THERE' do you not understand?

It happened to me too!

SCANsat marked an anomaly in that midland crater, I landed Muning Kerman there and... nothing to visit.

I'll make a rover with the BDT scan from SCANsat mod to see if it will be able to spot something.

EDIT BDT scan signals nothing inside the crater. Must send another rover because that save was corrupted, maybe this time I'll try to land at the precise coords...

Edited February 16, 2014 by PlonioFludrasco
Same here. I just landed in that midland crater at 250/300m of this anomaly and nothing. I managed to look underground and again, nothing. Sad I am

I just did a mission to mark all the anomalies on the Mun and I'm pretty sure I have them all. All of them were found using scanSat. There was one I remember having to search forever for. I'll get back to you guys on that just at work right now.

It's a monolith. very tiny and very black and very underground. This one did take me forever to find with just the top part of it sticking out. I don't think the scansat map is right on its location? i dunno. it's there though.

should i post some pictures?

Javascript is disabled. View full album
Edited March 25, 2014 by Cerberus738
added pictures
Well, it didn't even show a little bit of its top for me. And it seems your scanning satellite is a bit in too low orbit due to the shape of your map.

According to both http://www.kerbalmaps.com/ and SCANsat there should be an anomaly in the Midland Crater at -9.8314 , 25.9177. I am currently landed in that very same crater, almost exactly at those same coordinates. There is no anomaly, neither above ground nor below. No arch, no Munolith, no monument. Nothing but regular ground scatter.

Am I missing something or are both kerbalmaps.com and SCANsat wrong?

It is there, but under the ground according to your Ground-Detail Setting

Spoil yourself here

Well, it didn't even show a little bit of its top for me. And it seems your scanning satellite is a bit in too low orbit due to the shape of your map.

Terrain detail is on default. I found that when it is set high or low anomalies end up buried.

My scanner is set at 200km orbit for the black and white/anomaly scans. I read they work best at that altitude. Not to concerned with the color map. It will fill in eventually

Took me an hour or so to find it. I can confirm it is underground (using highest graphic settings and version 0.23).

I had to ram my point-of-view into the side of a hill and take quick screenshots in order to get quick glimpses of what was under ground.

Squad Monolith:In the background you can see my sky-crane.

I'm not sure that was worth the effort, but hey I found it!
